sentence.text: A male infant (case 2) of nonconsanguineous Caucasian parents was born at 37 weeksâ€™ gestation with left-sided CDH, talipes equinovarus and swallowing difficulties.
The CDH was repaired at age 3 days with a Gore-Tex patch, fundoplication and gastrostomy tube placement, with a good result.
On examination at 2 years of age, he had telecanthus (inner canthal distance of 33 mm; more than +2 s.d. above the mean) but no other dysmorphic features (Figure 2a).
A clinical diagnosis of male CFNS was made in the proband on the basis of the hypertelorism and family history.
Analysis of EFNB1 demonstrated a 3-nucleotide deletion in exon 2 (151_153delGTG, predicting V51del)
